pull.title: build: fix automake warnings about the use of INCLUDES
pull.body:
While we're at it, reduce the use of LIBS as well. This makes dependencies
explicit.

Fixes building with (the not-yet-merged) libsecp256k1 as well.

PR as requested in #4650.

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4689_af026ec2542d79840f2f39047c46c3204044442e/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

@theuni thanks
BTW: I suppose that this ilne at the top of Makefile.am can go too:

```
AM_CPPFLAGS =  $(INCLUDES)
```

events.message:
build: fix automake warnings about the use of INCLUDES

While we're at it, reduce the use of LIBS as well. This makes dependencies
explicit.

Fixes building with (the not-yet-merged) libsecp256k1 as well.
build: remove some more unused includes vars

events.body: Rebased and removed a few more things as suggested by @laanwj
How did toolbar.png end up in here :)
Heh, no clue how that happened. Busted rebase somewhere I guess. Thanks for catching and fixing.
